Imports

core, subjects

Procs

func just[T](v: T): Observable[T]
"Just" from ReactiveX

Example:

import rx
import sugar

var
  res: int
  isCompleted: bool

discard just(10)
  .subscribe(
    onNext = (x: int) => (res = x),
    onComplete = () => (isCompleted = true))

assert res == 10
assert isCompleted
func range[T: Ordinal](start: T; count: Natural): Observable[T]
"Range" from ReactiveX

Example:

import rx
import sugar

var
  res: int
  isCompleted: bool

discard range(1, 4)
  .subscribe(
    onNext = (x: int) => (res += x),
    onComplete = () => (isCompleted = true),
  )

assert res == 10
assert isCompleted
func repeat[T](upstream: Observable[T]; times: Natural = 0): Observable[T]

"Repeat" from ReactiveX
if "times" == 0: It will repeat stream infinitely.
if "times" >= 1: It will repeat stream "times" times.

func buffer[T](upstream: Observable[T]; timeSpan: Natural; skip: Natural = 0): Observable[
    seq[T]]
"Buffer" from ReactiveX

Example:

import rx
import sugar

var res = newSeq[int]()

discard range(0, 5)
  .buffer(2, 1)
  .filter(x => x.len == 2) # If "buffer" reciexed onComplete exent, it will flush stored xalues 
                          # whether it has enough length or not.
  .map(x => x[0]*x[1])
  .subscribe((x: int) => (res.add x))

doAssert res == @[0*1, 1*2, 2*3, 3*4]

Example:

import rx
import sugar

var res = newSeq[int]()

discard range(0, 6)
  .buffer(3)
  .filter(x => x.len == 3)
  .map(x => x[0] + x[1] + x[2])
  .subscribe((x: int) => (res.add x))

doAssert res == @[3, 12]
func map[T, S](upstream: Observable[T]; op: (T) -> S): Observable[S]
"Map" from ReactiveX

Example:

import rx
import sugar

var res = newSeq[int]()
let sbj = newSubject[int]()
discard sbj
  .map(x => x*10)
  .subscribe((x: int) => (res.add x))
sbj.onNext 1
sbj.onNext 2
sbj.onNext 3

doAssert res == @[10, 20, 30]
func filter[T](upstream: Observable[T]; op: (T) -> bool): Observable[T]
"Filter" from ReactiveX

Example:

import rx
import sugar

var res = newSeq[int]()
let sbj = newSubject[int]()
discard sbj
  .filter(x => x > 10)
  .subscribe((x: int) => (res.add x))
sbj.onNext 2
sbj.onNext 30
sbj.onNext 22
sbj.onNext 5
sbj.onNext 60
sbj.onNext 1

doAssert res == @[30, 22, 60]
func zip[Tl, Tr](tl: Observable[Tl]; tr: Observable[Tr]): Observable[(Tl, Tr)]
"Zip" from ReactiveX

Example:

import rx
import sugar, strformat

var res = newSeq[string]()
let sbj1 = newSubject[int]()
let sbj2 = newSubject[char]()
discard sbj1.zip( <>sbj2 )
  .subscribe((v: (int, char)) => res.add &"{v[0]}{v[1]}")
sbj1.onNext 1
sbj2.onNext 'A'
sbj1.onNext 2
sbj2.onNext 'B'
sbj2.onNext 'C'
sbj2.onNext 'D'
sbj1.onNext 3
sbj1.onNext 4
sbj1.onNext 5

doAssert res == @["1A", "2B", "3C", "4D"]
proc zip[T](upstream: Observable[T]; targets: varargs[Observable[T]]): Observable[
    seq[T]]
"Zip" from ReactiveX

Example:

import rx
import sugar, strformat

var res = newSeq[string]()
let
  sbj1 = newSubject[char]()
  sbj2 = newSubject[char]()
  sbj3 = newSubject[char]()
discard sbj1.zip( <>sbj2, <>sbj3 )
  .subscribe((x: seq[char]) => res.add &"{x[0]}{x[1]}{x[2]}")
sbj1.onNext '1'
sbj2.onNext 'a'
sbj1.onNext '2'
sbj3.onNext 'A'
sbj2.onNext 'b'
sbj1.onNext '3'
sbj3.onNext 'B'
sbj3.onNext 'C'

doAssert res == @["1aA", "2bB"]
func retry[T](upstream: Observable[T]): Observable[T]
"Retry" from ReactiveX 
proc concat[T](upstream: Observable[T]; targets: varargs[Observable[T]]): Observable[
    T]
"Concat" from ReactiveX

Example:

import rx
import sugar

var res = newSeq[int]()
let
  sbj1 = newSubject[int]()
  sbj2 = newSubject[int]()
discard sbj1.concat( <>sbj2 )
  .subscribe(
    onNext = (x: int) => res.add x,
    onComplete = () => res.add 0)
sbj1.onNext 1
sbj2.onNext 2
sbj1.onNext 1
sbj1.onComplete()
sbj2.onNext 2
sbj2.onComplete()

doAssert res == @[1, 1, 2, 0]
func publish[T](upstream: Observable[T]): ConnectableObservable[T]

Example:

import rx
import rx/unitUtils
import sugar

var cntCalled: int
let
  sbj = newSubject[Unit]()
  published = sbj
    .doThat((_: Unit) => (inc cntCalled))
    .publish()

sbj.onNext()
assert cntCalled == 0

discard published
  .subscribeBlock:
    discard

sbj.onNext()
assert cntCalled == 0

let disconnectable = published.connect()

sbj.onNext()
assert cntCalled == 1

discard published
  .subscribeBlock:
    discard

sbj.onNext()
assert cntCalled == 2

disconnectable.dispose()

sbj.onNext()
assert cntCalled == 2
proc connect[T](self: ConnectableObservable[T]): Disposable
See publish proc for examples. 
func refCount[T](upstream: ConnectableObservable[T]): Observable[T]
NOTE: There is something wrong with this behavior. Be careful when use it.
